de.cect.blockid.identitymanager.gerneral.common

Class CryptoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.cect.blockid.identitymanager.gerneral.common.CryptoUtils

  • @Component
public class CryptoUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for cryptographic requirements. This class basically contains convenience methods for the Java Security API.
    Since:
    blockid-0.0.1
    Author:
    ctinnes

    • Method Detail

      • getSignatureBase64

        public java.lang.String getSignatureBase64(byte[] binaryMessage,
                                           java.lang.String privateKeyBase64)
        Computes a signature of the given message by first computing the SHA-1 of the message and then encrypting this hash with the private key.
        Parameters:
        binaryMessage - the message.
        privateKeyBase64 - the base 64 encoded private key
        Returns:
        the base64 encoded signature.

      • verifySignatureBase64

        public java.lang.Boolean verifySignatureBase64(byte[] binaryMessage,
                                               java.lang.String signatureBase64,
                                               java.lang.String publicKeyBase64)
        Computes the SHA-1 hash of the given message and RSA decrypts the given signature with the given public key. Then the result of the comparison is returned.
        Parameters:
        binaryMessage - the original message.
        signatureBase64 - the base64 encoded signature.
        publicKeyBase64 - the base64 encoded public Key.
        Returns:
        true if signature is valid, false is it is not valid and null if verification failed for technical reasons.

      • encrypt

        public java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String strToEncrypt,
                                java.lang.String keyBase64,
                                java.lang.String algorithm)
        Encrypts the given string with the given algorithm(RSA or AES) and returns the base64 encoding of the cipher. In case of asymmetric encryption, it is assumed, that the given key is a public key.
        Parameters:
        strToEncrypt - the text to be encrypted
        keyBase64 - a key in base64 encoding.
        algorithm - the algorithm, i.e. RSA or AES
        Returns:
        the base64 encoded encrypted text or null if something fails.

      • decrypt

        public java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String strToDecrypt,
                                java.lang.String keyBase64,
                                java.lang.String algorithm)
        Decrypts the given base64 encoded string with the given algorithm(RSA or AES) and returns the base64 encoding of the cipher. In case of asymmetric encryption, it is assumed, that the given key is a private key.
        Parameters:
        strToEncrypt - the text to be encrypted
        keyBase64 - a key in base64 encoding.
        algorithm - the algorithm, i.e. RSA or AES
        Returns:
        the decrypted text (UTF-8) or null if something fails.

      • generateSecretAesKey

        public java.lang.String generateSecretAesKey()
        Generate a symmetric AES key.
        Returns:
        the base64 encoded string representing the AES key or null if not possible.

      • generateRsaKeyPair

        public java.security.KeyPair generateRsaKeyPair()
        Generate a asymmetric RSA key pair.
        Returns:
        the KeyPair representing the RSA keys or null if not possible.

      • getCipher

        private javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher(java.lang.String algorithm)
        Creates the cipher object for the encryption/decryption.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the algorithmn to create the cipher object for.
        Returns:
        the Cipher object.

      • getSecretKey

        private java.security.Key getSecretKey(java.lang.String keyBase64,
                                       java.lang.String algorithm,
                                       int mode)
        Generates the Key out of a base64 encoded key.
        Parameters:
        keyBase64 - the encoded key.
        algorithm - the algorithm to be used with the key.
        mode - specifies if private or public key should be generated.
        Returns:
        the Key for the given base64 encoded key and given algorithm and mode.

      • rsaPrivateKeyFromBase64

        private java.security.Key rsaPrivateKeyFromBase64(java.lang.String privateKeyBase64)
        Generate a asymmetric RSA private key from the given Base64 encoded binary.
        Parameters:
        privateKeyBase64 - the binary.
        Returns:
        the Key representing the RSA private key or null if not possible.

      • rsaPublicKeyFromBase64

        private java.security.Key rsaPublicKeyFromBase64(java.lang.String publicKeyBase64)
        Generate a asymmetric RSA public key from the given Base64 encoded binary.
        Parameters:
        publicKeyBase64 - the binary.
        Returns:
        the Key representing the RSA public key or null if not possible.

      • aesKeyFromBase64

        private java.security.Key aesKeyFromBase64(java.lang.String keyBase64)
        Generate a symmertic AES key from the given Base64 encoded binary.
        Parameters:
        keyBase64 - the binary.
        Returns:
        the Key representing the AES key or null if not possible.
